BUREAU OF CIVIL AVIATION SECURITY 
(MINISTRY OF CIVIL AVIATION) 
GOVERNMENT OF INDIA 
A WING , JANPATH  BHAWAN , 
JANPATH, NEW DELHI -110001 
Date: 29.12.2004 
 
C I R C U L A R  NO.  26/ 2004 
 
 
Sub: 
Extension of validity of the existing Airport Entry Pass (AEPs) till 31st 
January, 2005. 
 
As per the instructions in force, the existing Airport Entry Pass system is valid 
upto 31st December, 2004. 
 
In view of certain administrative constraints, it has been decided that the existing 
Airport Entry Passes shall be valid till 31st January, 2005 and the same shall be honoured 
by the Aviation Security Group of CISF and Airport Security Unit of State/ UT Police for 
gaining entry of persons for their legitimate functions at the airports in the country. 
 
Persons 
who 
have 
proceeded 
on 
superannuation 
or 
will 
proceed 
on 
superannuation on or before 31st December or those who are not on the job at an airport 
shall be personally responsible to surrender their Airport Entry Pass with their employers  
and they shall not use their AEPs for gaining entry to the airport, failing which they shall 
be liable for legal action as per the provisions of Aircraft Acts and Rules. 
 
 
(R.K. Singh) 
Addl. Commissioner of Security (CA) 
 
 
Distribution: 
As per list attached.
